job description:
About us

Founded in 2008, Cofactor Genomics is a biotechnology company pioneering the use of RNA to diagnose disease. The company’s novel technology combines biology with proprietary machine learning software to develop unique molecular diagnostics centered on RNA. Cofactor Genomics was founded by three former Human Genome Project molecular and data scientists and is dual headquartered in St. Louis, MO and San Francisco, CA.

To date, Cofactor Genomics has raised more than $20 million in funding, including an oversubscribed $18 million Series A in 2017. The company is backed by several top-tier investors including Menlo Ventures, Data Collective, Y Combinator, Ascension Ventures, Wilson Sonsini Goodrich & Rosati, and Stanford University, among others. Cofactor has been featured in many publications, including TechCrunch and Wired Magazine.

About the position

We are looking for an entry level scientist to lead the assembly and inventory management for molecular biology research kits. You will be a core member of the laboratory team and have a significant impact on the trajectory of the company.

What we're looking for
  • You possess basic knowledge of molecular biology techniques and some lab experience
  • You are highly organized and take pride in your ability to perform detail-oriented work
  • You enjoy continually learning and improving
  • You consistently deliver on commitments
  • You crave ownership and impact, and are highly self-motivated and driven
Job Requirements
  • Ability to perform basic lab tasks involving pipetting, labeling, reagent inventory, and order fulfillment
  • High attention to detail
  • Work with other team members to implement efficient production workflows using appropriate QC measures
  • Document work-related activities by completing production and quality check forms
  • Maintain component inventory and inventory system
  • Able to communicate issues and problems
  • QC background helpful
  • Previous experience packing or kitting reagents or medical devices is helpful
  • Biology/genomics knowledge is a plus
  • Must be able to lift up to 50 pounds
Perks and Benefits
  • Beautiful, light-filled office in the Cortex District
  • Equity options
  • 401k program with automatic employer contribution
  • Medical, dental, and vision insurance, and HSA available
  • Life insurance and short- and long-term disability insurance
  • Parental Leave
Sound like a fit?

Regardless of your level of experience, we look for people with high growth potential. We encourage you to apply early. We intend to hire the first person that is a good fit. Cofactor Genomics is an equal opportunity employer. We look forward to hearing from you!
